III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/16/23, staff member slammed youth on their head and put
their forearm on youth's neck. This was a result of youth walking
outside from the building. Staff member grabbed youth to keep
youth from walking away. Youth went to the hospital due to
injuries.
Investigation On 03/28/2023 a telephone conversation was held with
complainant. No additional information provided.
On 03/30/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Residential
Care Supervisor (RCS) at Clarence Fischer Center (CFC). A
request for the incident report was made and any other written
documentation relevant to the incident.
On 04/03/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A via
Zoom video interview. DHHS specialist was also present. Youth
A was discharged from residential and is placed with a relative.
Youth A was asked about what led to him being “escalated” from
CFC and he reported that he fought with Staff 1. He reported that
2

it happened on the trail, and he did not like what happened during
the restraint, so he fought Staff 1 by the main door. Youth A
described at first while walking on the trail he was mad, and Staff
1 grabbed him by the shirt. He reported he grabbed Staff 1 and
then they both went to the ground. Youth A reported that this is
when he was restrained by staff. Youth A stated he grabbed Staff
1 like a “hug from the front” and wrapped around his upper body.
Youth A reported he was restrained once on the ground and
indicated that it was about 5 or 6 staff involved but could not recall
who they were. He stated that he only remembered Staff 1.
Youth A stated he was on his stomach at first but was flipped to
his back because he was “bucking”. When asked if he got hurt,
he replied that “this is why I fought Staff 1”. He followed up by
denying that he was hurt when he was flipped to his back. He
further stated that Staff 1 was the one that flipped him to his back
and then shoved his arm into the front of his neck. He denied that
Staff 1 was saying anything and showed the lower bottom of his
forearm as an example of the part that was used by Staff 1. Youth
A reported that he was telling Staff 1 “when I get up, I’m beating
your ass”. Youth A was asked by the DHHS specialist if he was
having any difficulty breathing and he reported that he told Staff 1
that he was having a hard time breathing and Staff 1 told him to
“calm down”. Youth A reported that Staff 1 kept his forearm on his
neck until he calmed down. Youth A again denied remembering
any of the other staff that were present. Youth A stated that once
he stopped resisting and moving Staff 1 moved his arm. He
denied recalling how long Staff 1’s arm was on his neck and
stated that he doesn’t know if any other staff saw it and denied
that any other youth were outside. He also denied that anyone
was on his chest at any time during the restraint. Youth A then
stated that he pretended to act calm and ran toward the door and
Staff 1 followed him. Youth A recalled that there was a female
staff present also, but he could not recall who it was. Youth A
reported he “squared off with Staff 1 and punched him in his face”.
He reported he was standing over Staff 1 and was punching him.
He stated that he kept punching him and was restrained again, but
denied knowing who he was restrained by. He stated Staff 1 was
not involved in this particular restraint. Youth A reported that he
feels that he was “slammed on his head” in response to punching
Staff 1. He denied knowing who “slammed him on his head”
because it happened so fast. He stated that he hit his head on the
rocks by the main entrance walkway of CFC. Youth A reported
Youth B was also outside by this time, but staff would not let him
get close. He recalled that he was “on top of” Staff 1 and then all
the other staff (who he couldn’t recall the names of) grabbed him
and got him off of Staff 1. Youth A stated that it was “like 8 staff
3

out there” at one time. He was unable to identify the staff and
then later stated that he does not know if it was really 8 staff
present. Youth A denied knowing specifically what happened to
his lip or his right eye and denied that anything happened to it
during this restraint. He stated after he hit his head, he
remembered talking to a cop, but doesn't remember much
because he “blacked out”. Youth A further reported that “the
boss” (Chief Administrator) told them to let him up. Youth A
denied Chief Administrator was present during the entire restraint.
Youth A stated that he then talked to the cops, the cops left, and
staff took him to the hospital. He stated the hospital said he had a
concussion. Youth A denied being hurt anywhere else or in any
other way. Youth A recalled the names of two staff that assisted
with the restraint. He identified them as Staff 2 and Staff 3. He
stated Staff 2 was on his left arm and Staff 3 was on his legs.
Youth A denied that this has ever happened to him before. He
also denied that anything has happened like this with Staff 1. He
indicated he and Staff 1 are always “bumping heads”. He defined
“bumping heads” as getting into it. Youth A also denied seeing
Staff 1 or any other staff at CFC hurt youth.
On 04/03/2023 a video interview occurred with Aunt 1 via zoom.
The DHHS specialist was also present for this interview. Aunt 1
reported Youth A advised her that staff (without indicating specific
names) had put their “hands” on him, and he also put his “hands”
on staff, and this is why he was escalated. This was confirmed as
meaning “hitting” each other. Aunt 1 indicated that Youth A told
her Staff 1 was “kind of an ass” and that he had his arm on him to
where he could not breathe. She stated Youth A did not provide
specifics as to where the arm of Staff 1 was. Aunt 1 reported she
asked Youth A if he could breathe, and he responded yes. She
stated that she then joked with him that if he could talk, then he
could breathe. She denied being aware of any other concerns
during his placement at CFC.
On 04/04/2023 an in-person interview was completed with
Program Manager (PM) at CFC. The DHHS specialist was also
present. PM reported she was in a meeting at the time and is not
aware of what triggered the events with Youth A. She recalled
Staff 4 came to advise her that there was a restraint occurring in
the wooded area and requested her supervising assistance. She
recalled as she approached, Youth A was returning to the building
and the restraint in the wooded area had already concluded. She
stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were walking behind Youth A. She
stated Staff 5 or Staff 6 and RCS was also in the area outside.
PM stated Youth A was escalated so she and Staff 4 followed him
4

as he walked up to the door. Youth A was near the main door and
was kicking the central air unit. Youth A was also stating that he
was going to “turn up” the building. PM stated she was attempting
to redirect his behavior without success and advised staff not to let
him in the building until they could get him calmer. PM stated
Youth A turned around and told Staff 1 that he didn't have Staff 2
to help him anymore. PM reported she saw Youth A go toward
Staff 1 and Staff 1 began to back up and place his hands in a
protective stance. PM stated Youth A bear hugged Staff 1 and
threw him to the ground. PM reported she cannot recall where the
hands of Staff 1 were, but she remembered him trying to keep his
balance and not go to the ground. Youth A slammed Staff 1 into
the building and they both went to the ground. PM stated her and
Staff 4 began to assist, and she was quickly relieved by Staff 2.
PM recalled Youth A was successful in punching Staff 1 before
they made it to the ground. She was attempting to redirect him
and reported hearing Youth A say he was going to “beat your ass”
to Staff 1. PM stated at this time Staff 5 and Staff 6 came to
assist. Youth A was placed into a supine restraint due to him
being assaultive. PM reported she relieved Staff 1 and told him to
leave the area. PM recalled Youth A was “rolled” and that is how
he got from on top of Staff 1 to the bottom. She denied that Youth
A was slammed or flipped to the ground. PM stated that during
the restraint, the arms of Youth A were above his head. Staff 2
was on one arm and Staff 5 and Staff 6 were on the other arm and
lower legs. PM denied seeing anything of concern during the
restraint. She reported she remained in the area to monitor what
was being done. PM denied Youth A was reporting any pain or
that anything had been done “wrong” to him, however he was still
sent to medical for clearance. PM denied seeing Staff 1 attempt
to retaliate or swing on Youth A. She reported he was using
appropriate protective interventions. PM denied seeing any staff
near Youth A’s neck or chest. She also denied seeing him hit his
head on the ground. PM denied any issues with Staff 1 in the past
and denied any issues between Youth A and Staff 1. She did
acknowledge Youth A has punched Staff 1 during a past restraint.
PM reported Youth A apologized afterwards and their relationship
has been fine since then. PM denied that there was any outside
camera footage that was available for review. She referenced a
camera in the hallway and stated that only staff that were leaving
a training could be seen. PM was asked for copies of the video
footage for review.
On 04/04/2023 an in-person meeting occurred with Youth B at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth B reported
he has resided at CFC since March 2022. Youth B confirmed that
5

he is familiar with Youth A but denied any knowledge of the
incident that occurred outside with Staff 1. He denied seeing a
restraint by Staff 1 or any other staff. Youth B denied seeing Staff
1 be inappropriate with any youth. He stated that Staff 1
motivates the youth in the program to do good. Youth B denied
having concerns with any staff.
On 04/03/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 1 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1 reported he
is currently employed as a Youth Care Worker Supervisor. Staff 1
reported he recalled that Youth A as upset because he didn’t want
to go to the gym with his group. Youth A began punching walls in
the school and in the building and then made his way outside.
Staff 1 recalled that several staff followed Youth A outside,
including himself, Staff 2, Staff 4 and some other staff that he did
not recall the names of. Staff 1 reported he attempted to talk with
Youth A without any success. Youth A then walked to wooded
area near trail and bridge at CFC. Staff 1 reported that all of the
sudden, Youth A was charging at him, and bear hugged him at the
legs, picked him up and threw him to the ground. Staff 1 reported
he lost his balance and they both fell to the ground. Staff 1 stated
that when they fell, he was on top of Youth A. With the assistance
of staff in the area, Staff 1 said they went immediately into a
supine restraint. Staff 1 stated he was holding the arms of Youth
A and Staff 2 came over to assist with securing the arms. Staff 4
and Staff 3 were securing the legs of Youth A. Staff 1 denied that
his arm ever came close to the neck area of Youth A during the
restraint. Staff 1 stated he was in control the entire time of the
restraint. He reported talking to Youth A during the restraint to
calm him down. He recalled being successful and being able to
let Youth A out of the restraint. Staff 1 reported that everyone
began walking back to the unit. Staff 2 stopped to speak with
another staff. During this time, Youth A ran over and kicked the
central air unit. Youth A then started to approach Staff 1, stated
“Staff 3 ain’t here to save you” and then punched him in the face.
Staff 1 reported Youth A then wrapped his arms about him and
rushed him to the ground. Staff 1 recalled that he was on the
bottom and that Youth A continued to punch him in the face. Staff
1 stated he attempted to wrap his arms around Youth A to protect
himself. Staff 1 recalled that other staff came in to help, but he
doesn’t remember the names. He stated they assisted to roll
Youth A over and went directly into a supine restraint. Staff 1
stated he then disengaged and walked away. He denied that
Youth A was slammed to the ground and that excessive force was
used to roll him over. Staff 1 also denied hearing or seeing the
head of Youth A hit anything. Staff 1 reported that Youth B
6

attempted to head toward the restraint with a plan to get involved,
but Staff 1 spoke with him and was successful in redirecting him.
Staff 1 denied slamming or grabbing Youth A by the neck or his
arm being on the neck on Youth A. Staff 1 reported hearing Youth
A indicate that he had a “plan” to get staff to “swing on him” so
that Wolverine could get shutdown. Staff 1 stated he recalled a
small cut on the face of Youth A but does not know where it came
from. Staff 1 denied that Youth A was harmed in any way during
the restraint and denied seeing him hit the rocks in the area. Staff
1 denied that he has been inappropriate with any youth and
denied knowledge of any other staff being inappropriate with youth
at the facility.
On 04/04/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2 is currently
employed as a Youth Care Supervisor. Staff 2 recalled that Youth
A was upset about not following program and did not want to be
redirected. He recalled Youth A went outside and began walking
through the wooded area toward Vassar House. Staff 2 reported
that he was following behind him along with Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
that the next thing he knew Youth A had picked up Staff 1 and
they ended up falling to the ground. He could not remember what
position they fell in. Staff 2 stated that he went to assist and
grabbed the left arm of Youth A. He reported Staff 1 had the right
arm. Staff 3 and Staff 4 also came to assist and were on the legs
of Youth A. Staff 2 reported he could see and hear Staff 4 trying
to redirect and calm Youth A down. Staff 2 reported that the entire
incident was within his view, and he denied that the arms of Staff
1 went to the neck area of Youth A. Staff 2 reported that after
about 4 to 5 minutes of the restraint, Youth A seemed to be calm,
and they let him up. Everyone started walking back toward the
building and Staff 2 stated he stopped to talk with RCS. About 45
seconds later, he reported he heard some screaming and looked
and saw Staff 1 in a choke hold by Youth A. He also reported
Youth A was pulling Staff 1 down to the ground. Staff 2 stated PM
came out and was also trying to assist. Staff 2 stated he came
over to assist and relieved PM. Staff 2 recalled a meeting or
training was letting out in the building and Staff 5 and Staff 6 were
leaving the meeting and were able to assist. He reported things
happened so fast, he doesn’t remember who was on the legs and
who was on the arms, but stated Youth A was quickly placed into
a supine restraint and PM removed Staff 1 from the area. Staff 2
stated he does not remember how Youth A got over to his back
but denied that he was slammed by Staff 1 or anyone else used
excessive force. He denied seeing Youth A hit his head on the
rocks that were in the area, but stated it is possible that it could
7

have happened. Staff 2 stated that when the restraint was over,
law enforcement arrived to take a statement and Youth A was
transported to the hospital. Staff 2 reported Youth A was saying
that his head hurt after the restraint, so he was sent for an
evaluation. Staff 2 denied any concerns with Staff 1 with the
youth and indicated that most of the youth at the agency love him.
He further denied ever seeing Staff 1 be inappropriate during a
restraint.
On 04/04/2023 an in-person interview occurred with RCS at CFC.
The DHHS specialist was also present RCS reported that when
she became involved, all parties were already outside. She
recalled Youth A was upset and outside walking around. She
stated several staff were following him attempting to get him to
come back inside. RCS confirmed the staff following Youth A at
least included Staff 1 and Staff 2. She denied she was present
when the restraint began and only walked up to see Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 engaged in a supine restraint with Youth A.
RCS recalled Staff 4 was on the legs area, but requested
someone switch out with her because Youth A had a visible
erection and she wanted to minimize any additional allegations.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 switched positions with each other. Youth A
continued to yell and scream and was directing threats specifically
at Staff 1 and Staff 2. RCS denied seeing any inappropriate
actions during the restraint and denied seeing anyone’s arm near
the neck of Youth A. RCS stated Youth A began to calm down, so
she instructed them to release him. RCS stated that the Youth
still seemed to be a bit agitated and was talking “mess” but was
walking back toward the unit. RCS stated Staff 2 stopped to
converse with her and then they soon heard some commotion.
She stated she looked up she saw PM, Staff 5, Staff 4, Staff 3 and
Staff 6 trying to get Youth A off of Staff 1. Youth A could be seen
pulling the beard of Staff 1 and would not let it go. RCS reported
that she was unable to tell what position they were in, but noted
that they were initially standing up, but then falling to the ground.
RCS denied seeing or hearing Youth A hit his head on the ground.
She did confirm they were in the area by the entrance of the
building that has cement and rocks in the area. RCS reported she
was also occupied with trying to keep the other youth that were
playing basketball in the rec area, away from the scene of the
restraint. RCS reported hearing Youth A state he was “choked”
and that they slammed him on his head. RCS denied seeing any
of this occur and denied hearing Youth A state that he could not
breathe. RCS denied having any concerns with Staff 1. She
described him as a good staff person and reported he is known to
hold the youth accountable. She reported it seems that
8

sometimes Staff 1 is a target for the youth due to his mild
personality. RCS also confirmed CA arrived after the conclusion
of the restraints.
0n 04/04/2023 the video of the incident was reviewed. The
footage was captured from the camera in the hallway of CFC
which points towards the door and to the outside. The hallway and
a portion of the outside can be seen; however, the views are
obstructed due to the angle of the camera, the door frame, and
some staff who walk by the door as they are exiting. Additional
staff are seen in the video and identified for interviews. It
appeared that Youth A is released from a restraint at about
3:30pm and the police arrive around 3:45pm.
On 04/12/2023 an in-person meeting occurred with Staff 7 at CFC.
The DHHS specialist was present also. Staff 7 is employed as a
Youth Care Worker and confirmed that she was present at work
on the day of the incident (03/16/2023). She reported Youth A
was upset about something, left out of the building and went
outside. She stated she followed him outside and was also
accompanied by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4. She reported Youth
A remained angry, started walking toward the wooded area and
was saying threatening things to staff. Staff 7 reported hearing
Youth A say to Staff 1 “I’m going to beat your ass”. Staff 1 was
attempting to calm Youth A down but was unsuccessful. Staff 7
reported Youth A then “charges” toward Staff 1 with a bear hug
and slams Staff 1 to the ground. Staff 7 recalled when they fell to
the ground Staff 1 is no longer wrapped up by Youth A. Staff 1
gets up and works with other staff that are present to begin the
supine/team restraint. Staff 7 reported Youth A eventually agreed
to calm down and was released from the restraint. She reported
the restraint did not last long and was done correctly. She denied
seeing the arm of Staff 1 or any other staff near the neck of Youth
A. Staff 7 reported they began to head back toward CFC and
Staff 1 was appropriately following the youth. Staff 7 reported
Youth A turned around and says to Staff 1, “Staff 2 isn’t here to
protect you now and I’m going to beat your ass”. Youth A charges
toward Staff 1 and Staff 7 indicated that she doesn’t really recall
what happened after that, because it all became a blur. She
reported she knows that a second restraint occurred, and various
staff were trying to pull Youth A off of Staff 1. Staff 7 denied
seeing any negative or inappropriate actions occur by any of the
staff involved. She denied seeing Youth A hit his head and denied
seeing Staff 1 or any other staff slam the head of Youth A. Staff 7
further denied hearing Youth A state that he could not breathe
during any restraint. Staff 7 stated it is possible Youth A scraped
9

his face on the rocks in the area but denied that she saw it. She
further stated she has never had any concerns with Staff 1 or
witnessed him be inappropriate with the youth.
On 04/12/2023 an in-person meeting occurred with Staff 8 at CFC.
The DHHS specialist was present also. Staff is employed as a
Youth Care Supervisor. Staff 8 denied she was out in the wooded
area or witnessed any activity that took place in that area. She
reported she was exiting CFC and returning to Vassar when she
saw Youth A approaching the building and noted that he looked
upset. She recalled Staff 4 was telling her not to open the door or
let Youth A enter the building. She reported she quickly exited the
door and closed it so Youth A was not able to enter the building.
Staff 8 noted Staff 1 was also walking up and she assessed that
something had occurred as Staff 1 was purposely staying back.
Staff 8 noted Youth A began walking toward Staff 1 as if he
wanted to fight him. She reported she heard Staff 1 ask Youth A
not to come near him and she heard Youth A say “Staff 2 isn’t
here to save you” and then Youth A hit Staff 1 multiple times. She
reported they both fell over onto the rocks and Youth A was
grabbing the long beard of Staff 1. She reported Youth A also
kept hitting Staff 1. She stated Staff 5 and Staff 6 came to assist
and placed Youth A in a team restraint. She further recalled RCS
was directing all staff that was exiting the training from the area
and keeping the youth that were playing basketball outside away
from the area. Staff 8 denied seeing or hearing any staff slam
Youth A on his head or to the ground. She denied seeing Staff 1
punch Youth A. She reported that in her experience, Staff 1 does
a good job with the youth and spends a lot of time and patience
attempting to redirect the youth.
On 04/19/2023 an in-person interview occurred with Staff 9 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 9 is employed
as a Youth Care Worker Supervisor. Staff 9 reported being
outside and heard some commotion near CFC. He ran over to the
area. Upon his arrival, Staff 9 reported Youth A and Staff 1 were
already on the ground and Youth A had Staff 1 in a headlock. He
reported Staff 3 and Staff 8 were also in the area. As he was
approaching, he stated Staff 10 was approaching also. Staff 1
was attempting to get out of the headlock and Staff 8 stated he
was trying to get Youth A’s hands off of Staff 1. He was
successful in being able to release Youth A’s hands but reported
that it took the involvement of Staff 2 and Staff 10 also. Staff 8
reported the staff involved had to “move” Youth A and slide him
over. He denied Youth A was slammed to the ground and denied
recalling him hitting his head. Staff 8 did confirm Youth A had a
10

knot on his head but was unsure of how it occurred. Staff 8
denied any staff was near the neck of Youth A and placed their
hands or elbows in that area. He further denied that Youth A
stated he was in any pain. He recalled Youth A was stating that
he wanted to leave CFC and wanted to get escalated. Staff 8 also
advised that once Staff 1 was released from the hold of Youth A,
he left the area. He denied hearing Staff 1 say anything to Youth
A once he was released. Staff 8 further denied hearing or seeing
Staff 1 hit or do anything inappropriate to Youth A. He recalled
Youth A was calm when the restraint ended. He received Motrin,
spoke with Officer 1 and later returned to the cabin. Staff 8
assessed that Youth A was the aggressor in this situation and
denied any inappropriate action by any of the staff involved.
Further Staff 8 denied any concerns with Staff 1 in the past.
On 04/19/2023 an in-person interview occurred with Staff 4 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 4 is employed
as a Resident Care Supervisor and has been with the agency for
15 years. Staff 4 reported Youth A was upset and left out of the
facility and was followed by staff. She recalled hearing him state
that this is how he is going to get escalated today and making
statements that he wants to “be like his dad” and “I am going to
make someone swing on me today”. Staff 4 reported that she,
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were following Youth A. She stated she saw
Youth A pick up Staff 1 and slam him to the ground. She reported
that it all happened really fast. Youth A was on top of
Staff 1 and was hitting him. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 came to assist
and they all worked to get Youth A into a restraint. Staff 4
reported she requested to switch out with another staff person
based on Youth A seeming to be aroused based on her placement
on his leg area and Staff 3 came to assist. Staff 4 reported she
went to advise administration of the restraint and when she
returned Staff 1 and Youth A were walking back toward the
building. Youth A was making statements about plans to flood the
building, so he was not being allowed to enter without staff. Staff
4 stated she saw Youth A take a “fighting stance” and goes toward
Staff 1. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 started to step backward and
place his hands up. Youth A hit Staff 1 very hard in the face with
a closed fist. Staff 4 reported she thought his jaw was broken.
Staff 1 tried to get close to Youth A to prevent him from hitting him
again. Staff 4 stated she saw a bunch of yellow shirts come to the
area. She does not recall how but noted that they ended up on
the ground. Staff 10 came from his training class and began to
assist with the restraint also. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 1 swing
at or hit Youth A in any way. She denied seeing any staff have
their elbow near the neck of Youth A but did confirm Youth A had
11

a cut under his eye. Staff 4 reported he is not sure how Youth A
got the cut. She further denied seeing staff use inappropriate
force to get the youth to the ground during the restraint. Staff 4
denied Youth A complained of any pain after the restraint. She
ended by stating that she has never had any concerns with Staff 1
and he shows a lot of patience with the youth.
On 04/19/2023 an in-person interview occurred with Staff 10 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 10 is
employed as a Youth Care Worker Supervisor with the agency.
Staff 10 reported he was coming out of a meeting and saw the
incident taking place. He reported he saw Staff 1 being punched
and assaulted by Youth A. He reported Staff 1 grabbed Youth A
in the manner of a bear hug to try to stop him from continuing to
hit him. He further reported Staff 8 was on the scene and
attempting to assist and he switched out with her. Staff 10
reported Youth A was pulling the hair of Staff 1. Youth A was not
responding to requests to let the hair of Staff 1 go. Staff 10
reported Youth A and Staff 1 were already near the ground and
Staff 2 and Staff 6 were trying to get Youth A off of Staff 1. Staff
10 reported he joined, and they all were able to get Youth A into a
restraint and got Staff 1 loose from him. He reported Staff 1 then
left the area. Staff 10 denied anyone was on the chest or neck
area of Youth A. Staff 10 reported when they began to engage in
the restraint, Youth A and Staff 1 were already close to the ground
and tangled together. He reported he and the other staff involved
were able to turn Youth A over and he was flat on the ground.
Staff 10 denied he saw or heard Youth A hit his head on the
ground or the rocks. Staff 10 confirmed Youth A had a cut on his
eye but does not know how it got there and reported Youth A was
not complaining of any pain at the end of the restraint. Staff 10
reported Youth A was saying that he wanted to leave CFC and
that he had been waiting to attack Staff 1 and was going to get
him again. Staff 10 denied Staff 1 said anything inappropriate to
Youth A and denied any knowledge of concerns between Staff 1
and Youth A. Staff 10 also reported he had no concerns
regarding the action of Staff 2 and Staff 6 during the restraint.
Staff 10 reported the restraint lasted for about 3 or 4 minutes and
they let Youth A up once he calmed down and committed to
safety. Staff 10 denied ever seeing Staff 1 be inappropriate with
youth when working with him during past shifts.
On 04/25/2023 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 11.
The DHHS specialist also participated in the phone interview.

Documentation reviewed for this investigation includes the
following:
-Medical Records/Report: Report indicates that the eyes are
positive for photophobia. Negative for back pain and neck pain.
Positive for headaches; negative for tingling, sensory change,
focal weakness and loss of consciousness. Physical exam notes
he is awake, not in acute distress, normal appearance,
well developed, normal weight, and not ill appearing. There are no
marks, bruises, cuts, abrasions, or other injuries noted within the
exam. Assessment lists: Concussion without loss of
consciousness; initial encounter. Plan includes Tylenol as needed,
getting plenty of rest, reevaluation if there are worsening
symptoms, and follow up with primary care if needed.
-Incident Report of event on 03/16/2023: Information in incident
report was consistent with staff interviews.
-Police Report and Photos: Photos showed a small scratch/cut
under the right eye of Youth A and a scar to his upper lip. There
are also two photos that show the neck/chest area of Youth A and
the head of Youth A and no scars are noted in the photos. The
police report notes that law enforcement was dispatched to
respond to a report of assault. It indicates that Staff 1 had visible
injuries to the right side of his face. Staff 1 was identified as the
victim. Several staff and Youth A were interviewed by the Officer
that arrived. The interviews by law enforcement were found to be
consistent with my completed interviews. The report notes staff
advised that Youth A would be transported to Med Express as he
was complaining of dizziness.
14

-HR File of Staff 1: Staff 1 has documentation of a warning from
April 23rd for failure to communicate about coverage of line of
sight in the unit with regard to ratio. Staff 1 failed to give proper
communication directives and did not ensure YCW was assigned
to proper coverage necessary for supervision prior to leaving his
shift. He was provided a written warning. It was also confirmed
that Staff 1 has completed CPI training on 03/28/2023.
-Review of Restraint Model of Agency: The agency utilizes the
CPI: Non-violent Crisis intervention, Trauma Informed Version, 2nd
edition. It is a nationally recognized program designed for youth
living in a Child Caring Institution. The emphasis of CPI: trauma-
informed is prevention and de-escalation and looks at physical
management as a choice only in emergent situations.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was not sufficient
evidence to determine that the agency was in non-compliance
with licensing rule 400.4158. Interviews were completed with
Youth A and several staff that were present during the incident on
03/16/23. There was no evidence to support that the staff
engaged in physical punishment of Youth A. The staff interviewed
were consistent in their report that denied that Staff 1 or any other
staff placed their arm or elbow on the neck of Youth A or slammed
Youth A on his head.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
